title: Fully Passive Quantum Conference Key Agreement
authors: Jinjie Li, Wenyuan Wang and H. F. Chau
abstract:
Quantum Conference Key Agreement (CKA) provides a secure method for
multi-party communication. A recently developed interference-based
prepare-and-measure quantum CKA possesses the advantages of
measurement-device-independence, namely, being immune to side-channels from the
detector side. Besides, it achieves good key rate performance, especially for
high-loss channels, due to the use of single photon interference. Meanwhile,
several fully passive QKD schemes have been proposed, which eliminate all side
channels from the source modulation side. We extend the fully passive idea to
an interference-based CKA, which has a high level of implementation security
for many-user communication.
